metadata.title: CVE-2024-23848 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 6.7.1, there is a use-after-free incec_queue_msg_fh, related to drivers/media/cec/core/cec-adap.c anddrivers/media/cec/core/cec-api.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-23848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-121-generic - 5.15.0-121.131~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-121-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-121.131~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-121-generic - 5.15.0-121.131~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-121-generic-64k - 5.15.0-121.131~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1069-aws - 5.15.0-1069.75~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1072-azure - 5.15.0-1072.81~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1068-gcp - 5.15.0-1068.76~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1052-gkeop - 5.15.0-1052.59~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1062-ibm - 5.15.0-1062.65~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1064-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1064.70~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-121-lowlatency - 5.15.0-121.131~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-121-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-121.131~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1067-oracle - 5.15.0-1067.73~20.04.1
No subscription required
